name: Absol G
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokemon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poke-Powers, Poke-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Return all Energy cards attached to Absol G to your hand. The Defending Pokemon is Knocked Out at the end of your opponent's next turn.

name: Blaziken FB
Attack1Text: Switch the Defending Pokemon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. The new Defending Pokemon is now Burned.
Attack2Text: If your opponent has any Water Pokemon in play, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Drifblim FB
Ability1Text: If your opponent has 3 or less Prize cards left, Drifblim FB gets +40 HP.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokemon. Apply Weakness and Resistance.

name: Electivire FB
Attack1Text: Discard up to 2 Energy cards from your hand. For each card you discarded, draw 2 cards.
Attack2Text: Move a Lightning Energy card attached to Electivire FB to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Garchomp
Ability1Text: If Garchomp is your Active Pokemon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Garchomp is Knocked Out), choose an Energy card attached to the Attacking Pokemon and put it into your opponent's hand.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Garchomp by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Does 120 damage minus 20 damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Magmortar
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you play Magmortar from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon, you may use this power. Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned and Confused.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: You may move a Fire Energy card attached to Magmortar to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Metagross
flavorText: Metang combined to form it. With four brains, it has the intelligence of a supercomputer.
Ability1Text: Each Pokemon in play (both yours and your opponent's) gets -20 HP. No more than 20 HP can be reduced by all Gravitation Poke-Bodies.
Attack1Text: If you have a Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon that is the same type as the Defending Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Rayquaza C
Attack1Text: You may discard up to 5 Energy cards from your hand. If you do, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card you discarded.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. If both are tails, this attack does nothing. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Regigigas FB
Attack1Text: Remove from Regigigas FB a number of damage counters equal to the amount of Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage times the number of different types of Pokemon SP you have in play.

name: Rhyperior
flavorText: It can launch a rock held in its hand like a missile by tightening then expanding muscles instantly.
Attack1Text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Rhyperior.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon would be Knocked Out by this attack, discard the top 3 cards from your opponent's deck.

name: Staraptor FB
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.
Attack2Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon.

name: Swampert
Ability1Text: Any damage done to Swampert by attacks from your opponent's Pokemon that isn't an Evolved Pokemon is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Before doing damage, you may switch your opponent's Active Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each Fighting Energy attached to Swampert.

name: Venusaur
Ability1Text: Remove all Special Conditions from each of your Grass Pokemon. Each of your Grass Pokemon can't be affected by any Special Conditions.
Attack1Text: If Venusaur already has 8 or more damage counters on it, the Defending Pokemon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon is affected by any Special Conditions, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage for each of those Special Conditions.

name: Yanmega
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Yanmega is your Active Pokemon, you may search your discard pile for a Grass Energy card and attach it to Yanmega. This power can't be used if Yanmega is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: You may return all Grass Energy attached to Yanmega to your hand. If you do, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy card you returned.

name: Arcanine G
Ability1Text: Arcanine G's Retreat Cost is Colorless less for each Fire Energy attached to Arcanine G.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Articuno
flavorText: A legendary bird Pokemon. It can create blizzards by freezing moisture in the air.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Butterfree FB
Ability1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon has any Poke-Bodies, each of Butterfree FB's attacks does 30 more damage to the Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Choose either Burned or Poisoned. The Defending Pokemon is now affected by that Special Condition.

name: Camerupt
flavorText: It has volcanoes on its back. If magma builds up in its body, it shudders, then erupts violently.
Attack1Text: You may move a Fire Energy card attached to 1 of your Benched Pokemon to Camerupt.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. For each tails, discard the top card of your deck. Ignore this effect if your opponent has any Water Pokemon in play.

name: Camerupt G
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Burned.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Charizard G
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Chimecho
flavorText: Its cries echo inside its hollow body to emerge as beautiful notes for startling and repelling foes.
Attack1Text: Remove 3 damage counters from each of your Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. Count the amount of Energy attached to that Pokemon. Put that many damage counters on the Pokemon.

name: Claydol
flavorText: An ancient clay figurine that came to life as a Pokemon from exposure to a mysterious ray of light.
Attack1Text: Put 3 damage counters on any Pokemon (both yours and your opponent's) in any way you like.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon has the same remaining HP as Claydol, this attack's base damage is 90 instead of 30.

name: Crawdaunt G
Attack1Text: You may switch Crawdaunt G with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Dewgong
Ability1Text: Any damage done to Dewgong by attacks from Fire Pokemon and Water Pokemon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon is a Fighting Pokemon, this attack's base damage is 80 instead of 30.

name: Dodrio
flavorText: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card. This power can't be used if Dodrio is affected by a Special Condition.

name: Dusknoir FB
Attack1Text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage times the number of Pokemon SP in your discard pile.

name: Empoleon FB
Attack1Text: Move an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon to another of your opponent's Pokemon.
Attack2Text: If you played any Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Exploud
Ability1Text: Each of your Pokemon has no Weakness.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Honchkrow
flavorText: If one utters a deep cry, many Murkrow gather quickly. For this, it is called "Summoner of Night."
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Honchkrow is your Active Pokemon and your opponent's Bench isn't full, you may use this power. Search your opponent's discard pile for a Basic Pokemon and put it onto his or her bench. This power can't be used if Honchkrow is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Pokemon that isn't an evolved Pokemon in play (both yours and your opponent's).

name: Lickilicky C
Attack1Text: Attach a Basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokemon. Then, remove 2 damage counters from that Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

name: Lucario C
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Lunatone
flavorText: Because it turns active on nights of the full moon, it is said to have some link to the lunar phases.
Ability1Text: If you have Solrock in play, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to any of your Lunatone or Solrock by your opponent's Pokemon LV.X.
Attack1Text: Does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon that doesn't have a Retreat Cost. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Mawile
Attack1Text: During your next turn, any damage done by Mawile's Swallow or Bite to your opponent's Active Pokemon is increased by 40 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Remove from Mawile the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Medicham
flavorText: It gains the ability to see the aura of its opponents by honing its mind through starvation.
Attack1Text: Your opponent draws 2 cards.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each card in your opponent's hand.

name: Milotic C
Attack1Text: Flip a coin for each Water Energy attached to Milotic C. This attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Moltres
flavorText: One of the legendary bird Pokemon. It is said that its appearance indicates the coming of spring.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Mr. Mime
flavorText: It shapes an invisible wall in midair by minutely vibrating its fingertips to stop molecules in the air.
Ability1Text: If Mr. Mime would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack that does 70 or more damage (after applying Weakness and Resistance), Mr. Mime is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.
Attack1Text: If Mr. Mime already has 5 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage.

name: Parasect
flavorText: A mushroom grown larger than the host's body controls Parasect. It scatters poisonous spores.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Grass Energy cards and attach them to any of your Pokemon in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep. Flip 2 coins instead of 1 between turns. If either of them is tails, the Defending Pokemon is still Asleep.

name: Primeape
flavorText: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.
Attack1Text: Discard the top card from your opponent's deck. If you discarded a Pokemon, this attack does damage equal to the HP of that Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance, Poke-Powers, Poke-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokemon.

name: Roserade C
Ability1Text: When you attach an Energy card from your hand to Roserade C, remove all Special Conditions from Roserade C.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and remove 2 damage counters from Roserade C.

name: Sableye G
Attack2Text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at that card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

name: Sandslash
flavorText: It curls up, then rolls into foes with its back. Its sharp spines inflict severe damage.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 5 cards in your deck. Choose as many Fighting Energy cards as you like, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Put the other cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Sandslash is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

name: Seaking
flavorText: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, if Seaking would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, Seaking is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

name: Shedinja
flavorText: A discarded bug shell that came to life. Peering into the crack on its back is said to steal one's spirit.
Ability1Text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Shedinja by your opponent's Pokemon that has any Poke-Powers or Poke-Bodies.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon that has any damage counters on it. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Solrock
flavorText: A new Pokemon species, rumored to be from the sun. It gives off light while spinning.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Lunatone in play, you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order. This power can't be used if Solrock is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: If Lunatone is in your discard pile, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage. Then, search your discard pile for Lunatone, show it to your opponent, and shuffle it into your deck.

name: Spinda
flavorText: No two Spinda have the same pattern of spots. Its tottering step fouls the aim of foes.
Attack1Text: If any Energy card attached to Spinda is the same type as any Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon, discard 1 of those Energy cards from the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon already has any damage counters on it, this attack's base damage is 10 instead of 30.

name: Wailord
flavorText: The biggest of all Pokemon. It can dive to a depth of almost 10,000 feet on only one breath.
Attack1Text: Remove all Special Conditions and 4 damage counters from Wailord. Wailord is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Wailord can't use Giant Wave during your next turn.

name: Zapdos
flavorText: A legendary Pokemon that is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Altaria C
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

name: Arcanine
flavorText: Its proud and regal appearance has captured the hearts of people since long ago.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Bibarel
flavorText: A river dammed by Bibarel will never overflow its banks, which is appreciated by people nearby.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Breloom
flavorText: Its short arms stretch when it throws punches. Its technique is equal to that of pro boxers.
Attack1Text: The Retreat Cost for the Defending Pokemon is 0 until the end of your next turn.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon has any Special Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage. Then, discard a Special Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Carnivine
flavorText: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove from Carnivine the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Chatot G
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Chatot G from your hand onto your Bench, you may look at the top 4 cards of your opponent's deck. Put them back on top of your opponent's deck in any order.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Put Chatot G and all cards attached to it on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Cherrim
flavorText: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. Cherrim is now Confused.

name: Dragonite FB
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon is a Pokemon SP, this attack's base damage is 80 instead of 20.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Drifblim
flavorText: At dusk, swarms of them are carried aloft on winds. When noticed, they suddenly vanish.

name: Floatzel
flavorText: It is a common sight around fishing ports. It is known to rescue people and carry off prey.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Gabite
flavorText: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.
Attack1Text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokemon.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Garchomp C
Attack2Text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Hippopotas
flavorText: It shuts its nostrils tight then travels through sand as if walking. They form colonies of around ten.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Ivysaur
flavorText: When the bud on its back starts swelling, a sweet aroma wafts to indicate the flower's coming bloom.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you play Ivysaur from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon, you may use this power. Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Lopunny
flavorText: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Loudred
flavorText: The shock waves from its cries can tip over trucks. It stamps its feet to power up.
Attack2Text: Discard the top card from your opponent's deck.

name: Magmar
flavorText: When it breathes deeply, heat waves form around its body, making it hard to see clearly.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Magmar.

name: Manectric G
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 Energy cards and attach them to Manectric G.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Marshtomp
flavorText: Its sturdy legs give it sure footing, even in mud. It burrows into dirt to sleep.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Marshtomp is on your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, move all Energy cards attached to your Active Pokemon to Marshtomp. If you do, switch Marshtomp with that Active Pokemon.

name: Masquerain
flavorText: Its antennae have eye patterns on them. Its four wings enable it to hover and fly in any direction.
Ability1Text: As long as Masquerain is your Active Pokemon, any damage done by an opponent's attack is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Draw 2 cards.

name: Metang
flavorText: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its steel body won't be scratched if it collides with a jet.
Ability1Text: If Metang has any Metal Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost for Metang is 0.
Attack1Text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Milotic
flavorText: Its lovely scales are described as rainbow colored. They change color depending on the viewing angle.
Attack1Text: You may discard 2 cards from your hand. If you do, remove 4 damage counters from 1 of your Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Does 90 damage minus 10 damage for each card in your hand.

name: Minun
flavorText: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Basic Pokemon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokemon.

name: Murkrow
flavorText: If spotted, it will lure an unwary person into chasing it, then lose the pursuer on mountain trails.
Attack1Text: Move a Pokemon Tool card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon to another of your opponent's Pokemon (excluding Pokemon that already has a Pokemon Tool attached to it). (If an effect of this attack is prevented, this attack does nothing.)

name: Ninjask
flavorText: Because it moves so quickly, it sometimes becomes unseeable. It congregates around tree sap.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Switch Ninjask with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Remove from 1 of your Pokemon the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Numel
flavorText: Its humped back stores intensely hot magma. In rain, the magma cools, slowing its movement.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 Fire Energy cards and attach them to Numel.

name: Pinsir
flavorText: It grips prey with its pincers until the prey is torn in half. What it can't tear, it tosses far.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent returns the Defending Pokemon and all cards attached to it to his or her hand.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon is a Stage 2 Pokemon, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Plusle
flavorText: It cheers on friends with pom-poms made of sparks. It drains power from telephone poles.
Attack1Text: If you have the same number of cards or less in your hand as your opponent, draw cards until you have 1 more card than your opponent. (If you have more cards in your hand than your opponent, this attack does nothing.)
Attack2Text: Attach a Lightning Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokemon.

name: Raichu
flavorText: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Raticate G
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for a Trainer card or a Supporter card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin, if heads this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Relicanth
flavorText: A rare Pokemon discovered during a deep-sea exploration. It has not changed in over 100 million years.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon for each Pokemon Tool and Stadium card your opponent has in play. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokemon's attacks. That Pokemon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

name: Rhydon
flavorText: Standing on its hind legs freed its forelegs and made it smarter. It is very forgetful, however.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

name: Roserade
flavorText: Each of its hands contains different toxins, but both hands can jab with near-fatal power.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Rotom
flavorText: Its electric-like body can enter some kinds of machines and take control in order to make mischief.
Attack1Text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to Rotom. Flip a coin for each Energy card you discarded. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Skarmory FB
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, when your opponent puts a Basic Pokemon from his or her hand onto his or her Bench, put 2 damage counters on that Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Discard all Metal Energy attached to Skarmory FB. Flip a coin for each Energy card you discarded. This attack does 20 damage plus 40 damage for each heads.

name: Spiritomb C
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Staravia
flavorText: Recognizing their own weakness, they always live in a group. When alone, a Staravia cries noisily.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Togekiss C
Attack1Text: Draw a card.
Attack2Text: Togekiss C does 10 damage to itself.

name: Wailmer
flavorText: On sunny days, it lands on beaches to bounce like a ball and play. It spouts water from its nose.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Wailmer but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.
Attack2Text: Wailmer does 20 damage to itself.

name: Yanma
flavorText: It can hover is one spot by flapping its wings at high speed. It flits about to guard its territory.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy attached to Yanma.

name: Baltoy
flavorText: It moves by spinning on its foot. It is a rare Pokemon that was discovered in ancient ruins.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Beldum
flavorText: It converses with others by using magnetic pulses. In a swarm, they move in perfect unison.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Bidoof
flavorText: A comparison revealed that Bidoof's front teeth grow at the same rate as Rattata's.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Buizel
flavorText: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.

name: Bulbasaur
flavorText: For some time after its birth, it grows by gaining nourishment from the seed on its back.

name: Buneary
flavorText: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.
Attack1Text: Switch Buneary with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Remove 1 damage counter from Buneary.

name: Chatot
flavorText: Its tongue is just like a human's. As a result, it can cleverly mimic human speech.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokemon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Chatot does 10 damage to itself.

name: Cherubi
flavorText: The small ball is not only filled with nutrients, it is also tasty. Starly try to peck it off.
Attack1Text: Attach a Grass Energy from your hand to Cherubi.

name: Chimchar
flavorText: It is very agile. Before going to sleep, it extinguishes the flame on its tail to prevent fires.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Chingling
flavorText: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Chimecho from your hand onto Chingling (this counts as evolving Chingling) and remove all damage counters from Chingling.
Attack1Text: Search your opponent's discard pile for a Supporter card and use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack. (The Supporter card remains in your opponent's discard pile.)

name: Combee
flavorText: The trio is together from birth. It constantly gathers honey from flowers to please Vespiquen.
Attack1Text: Remove 2 damage counters from Combee.

name: Corphish
flavorText: Its hardy vitality enables it to adapt to any environment. Its pincers will never release prey.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Croagunk
flavorText: It rarely fights fairly, but that is strictly to ensure survival. It is popular as a mascot.

name: Doduo
flavorText: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.
Attack1Text: Doduo does 10 damage to itself.

name: Drifloon
flavorText: Because of the way it floats aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a "Signpost for Wandering Spirits."
Attack1Text: Drifloon does 10 damage to itself.
Attack2Text: Draw a card.

name: Feebas
flavorText: It is a shabby and ugly Pokemon. However, it is very hardy and can survive on little water.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: Draw a card for each of your opponent's Pokemon that isn't an Evolved Pokemon.

name: Geodude
flavorText: At rest, it looks just like a rock. Carelessly stepping on it will make it swing its fists angrily.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Gible
flavorText: It attacks using its huge mouth. While its attacks are powerful, it hurts itself out of clumsiness, too.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

name: Goldeen
flavorText: Though it appears very elegant when swimming with fins unfurled, it can jab powerfully with its horn.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Goldeen.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Growlithe
flavorText: A Pokemon with a loyal nature. It will remain motionless until it is given an order by its Trainer.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Growlithe.

name: Kricketot
flavorText: Its legs are short. Whenever it stumbles, its stiff antennae clack with a xylophone-like sound.

name: Magikarp
flavorText: A Magikarp living for many years can leap a mountain using Splash. The move remains useless, though.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Magnemite
flavorText: The faster the units at its sides rotate, the greater the magnetic force they generate.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Mankey
flavorText: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon is a Pokemon LV.X, this attack does 10 damage plus 50 more damage.

name: Meditite
flavorText: It always trains deep in mountains. It levitates when it heightens its spiritual power through meditation.
Attack2Text: Does 30 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Meditite.

name: Meowth
flavorText: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Mime Jr.
flavorText: It mimics the expressions and motions of those it sees to understand the feelings of others.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Mr. Mime from your hand onto Mime Jr. (this counts as evolving Mime Jr.) and remove all damage counters from Mime Jr.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokemon's attacks. That Pokemon can use only that attack during your opponent's next turn.

name: Mudkip
flavorText: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.
Attack1Text: If Mudkip has less Energy attached to it than the Defending Pokemon, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Nincada
flavorText: It grows underground, sensing its surroundings using antennae instead of its virtually blind eyes.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokemon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Pachirisu
flavorText: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Paras
flavorText: Mushrooms named tochukaso grow on its back. They grow along with the host Paras.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Pikachu
flavorText: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Piplup
flavorText: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.

name: Rhyhorn
flavorText: Its powerful tackles can destroy anything. However, it is too slow witted to help people work.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Roselia
flavorText: The more healthy the Roselia, the more pleasant its flowers' aroma. Its scent deeply relaxes people.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Sandshrew
flavorText: To protect itself from attackers, it curls up into a ball. It lives in arid regions with minimal rainfall.

name: Seel
flavorText: A Pokemon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Shinx
flavorText: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.

name: Shroomish
flavorText: It spouts poison spores from the top of its head. These spores cause pain all over if inhaled.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Skorupi
flavorText: As soon as the tail claws close, its needle tips secrete poison. It can survive a year without food.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Starly
flavorText: Because they are weak individually, they form groups. However, they bicker if the group grows too big.

name: Surskit
flavorText: It appears as if it is skating on water. It draws prey with a sweet scent from the tip of its head.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Turtwig
flavorText: The shell on its back is made of soil. On a very healthy Turtwig, the shell should feel moist.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Whismur
flavorText: Usually, its cries are like quiet murmurs. If frightened, it shrieks at the same volume as a jet plane.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Zubat
flavorText: It checks its surroundings and location using reflections of the ultrasonic waves from its mouth.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Absol G LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Absol G LV.X from your hand onto your Active Absol G, you may flip 3 coins. For each heads, put the top card from your opponent's deck in the Lost Zone.
Attack1Text: You may discard a card from your hand. If you do, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Blaziken FB LV.X
Ability1Text: Any damage done by attacks to a Burned Pokemon (both yours and your opponent's) is increased by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). No more than 40 damage can be added by all Burning Spirit Poke-Bodies.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Blaziken FB by attacks is increased by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Charizard G LV.X
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move an Energy attached to 1 of your Pokemon to Charizard G. This power can't be used if Charizard G is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Energy attached to Charizard G.

name: Electivire FB LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. If you do, your turn ends. Search your discard pile for up to 3 Energy cards and attach them to your Pokemon in any way you like. This power can't be used if Electivire FB is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to all of your Pokemon.

name: Garchomp C LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Garchomp C LV.X from your hand onto your Active Garchomp C, you may remove all damage counters from each of your Pokemon SP.
Attack1Text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Garchomp C. Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 80 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Garchomp C can't use Dragon Rush during your next turn.

name: Rayquaza C LV.X
Ability1Text: If Rayquaza C is your Active Pokemon and is damaged but not Knocked Out by an opponent's attack, you may search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Rayquaza C.
Attack1Text: Discard all Energy attached to Rayquaza C. Ignore this effect if you have no cards in your hand.

name: Staraptor FB LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Supporter card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Staraptor FB is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Before doing damage, you may discard any Stadium card in play. If you do, this attack's base damage is 70 instead of 40.

name: Articuno
flavorText: This legendary Pokemon is said to freeze the water in the air during winter, causing snow.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed and this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Moltres
flavorText: The flames on this legendary Pokemon's wings burn so brightly that they can make night seem like day.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a Fire Energy attached to Moltres. If tails, discard all Energy attached to Moltres.

name: Zapdos
flavorText: This legendary Pokemon is said to be present wherever there is a lightning storm.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) If tails, Zapdos does 30 damage to itself.

name: Milotic
flavorText: Its lovely scales are described as rainbow colored. They change color depending on the viewing angle.
Ability1Text: If you have no cards in your hand, prevent all damage done to Milotic by attacks from your opponent's Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Does 80 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Milotic.

name: Relicanth
flavorText: A rare Pokemon discovered during a deep-sea exploration. It has not changed in over 100 million years.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokemon's Retreat Cost is ColorlessColorless more.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

name: Yanma
flavorText: It can hover in one spot by flapping its wings at high speed. It flits about to guard its territory.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.
Attack2Text: You may switch Yanma with 1 of your Benched Pokemon. If you do, move as many Energy cards attached to Yanma as you like to the new Active Pokemon.
